intro: Crotalaria conferta, commonly known as the clustered crotalaria, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It is a member of the Fabaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and showy, yellow or orange flowers. The plant typically grows as an annual or perennial herb, often found in disturbed soils and open habitats. Its seed pods are distinctive, being hairy and containing several small, kidney-shaped seeds. Crotalaria conferta is also known for its ability to fix nitrogen, making it beneficial in certain agricultural contexts.
